snippet: America’s $250 million in aid should inspire Mohamed Morsi and his opponents to stop the infighting and turn around their failing state.
abstract: Editorial praises Pres Obama's decision to provide $250 million in aid to Egypt, calling it vote of confidence in country that is critical to stability in region but is also teetering on edge of economic disaster; calls on Egypt's government and its opposition to create political and economic consensus that can leverage aid money to turn around failing state.
lead_paragraph: America’s $250 million in aid should inspire Mohamed Morsi and his opponents to stop the infighting and turn around their failing state.
